results.title: New York Philharmonic Opens Its Season Amid Labor Talks and Troubles
results.abstract: The orchestra is working to negotiate a new contract with musicians, resolve a misconduct inquiry and hire a new chief executive.

results.title: A Wide-Open Oscar Season Begins to Narrow
results.abstract: After film festivals in Venice, Telluride and Toronto, a slate of contenders has emerged. Still, there are few front-runners.

results.title: Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s Voice Stunned the World (and Will Again)
results.abstract: “Chain of Light,” an album of four qawwalis the Pakistani singer recorded in 1990, are arriving after being discovered in the vaults of Peter Gabriel’s label.

multimedia.caption: Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, who died in 1997 at age 48, brought the magic of qawwalis — songs based on the devotional poetry of Sufism — to the world.

results.title: ‘A Face in the Crowd’ Isn’t About Trump. It Just Seems Like It.
results.abstract: Elvis Costello and Sarah Ruhl’s musical adaptation of the 1957 film, a satire about a hustler turned power-hungry TV personality, hits the London stage.

multimedia.caption: The actors Ramin Karimloo, left, and Anoushka Lucas during rehearsals for “A Face in the Crowd,” a new musical opening Sept. 20 at the Young Vic in London.
The actors Ramin Karimloo, left, and Anoushka Lucas during rehearsals for “A Face in the Crowd,” a new musical opening Sept. 20 at the Young Vic in London.

results.title: A (Very) Belated Donizetti Premiere in South Africa
results.abstract: The 1838 score for “Dalinda,” which uses chunks of “Lucrezia Borgia,” was found in Naples in 2019. A student company in Cape Town just gave the first staged performance.

multimedia.caption: Molly Dzangare and Luvo Maranti in the world premiere staging of Donizetti’s “Dalinda.” Dzangare sang the title role and Maranti played her son, Ildemaro.
Molly Dzangare and Luvo Maranti in the world premiere staging of Donizetti’s “Dalinda.” Dzangare sang the title role and Maranti played her son, Ildemaro.

results.title: How a Video Game Shows the Imaginative Potential of Picture Books
results.abstract: In the Plucky Squire, a young hero fights a villainous wizard to become “the master of his storybook,” says Jamie Turner, the co-director of the game.

results.title: After ‘a Treasure Hunt,’ a Cut-Up Masterpiece Returns to Venice
results.abstract: More than 200 years after a ceiling painted by the Tuscan artist Vasari was dismembered and sold on the antiquarian market, it is (almost) whole again.

results.title: Common Ground, and Conflict, Between 2 Stars of Land Art
results.abstract: A retrospective pairing Teresita Fernández and Robert Smithson shows they share sympathetic, deep engagement with geology and civilization.

multimedia.caption: Robert Smithson and Teresita Fernández share billing at Site Santa Fe, a survey in New Mexico. From left, Smithson’s “A Nonsite (Franklin, New Jersey),” 1968; Fernández, “Viñales (Plateau),” 2019; Fernández, “Viñales (Reclining Nude),” 2015; and Smithson, “Road to Crater,” 1969.

Robert Smithson and Teresita Fernández share billing at Site Santa Fe, a survey in New Mexico. From left, Smithson’s “A Nonsite (Franklin, New Jersey),” 1968; Fernández, “Viñales (Plateau),” 2019; Fernández, “Viñales (Reclining Nude),” 2015; and Smithson, “Road to Crater,” 1969.

Robert Smithson and Teresita Fernández share billing at Site Santa Fe, a survey in New Mexico. From left, Smithson’s “A Nonsite (Franklin, New Jersey),” 1968; Fernández, “Viñales (Plateau),” 2019; Fernández, “Viñales (Reclining Nude),” 2015; and Smithson, “Road to Crater,” 1969.

results.title: Is the Comedy-Club Booking Process Broken?

results.title: Sean Combs’s New Home: A Troubled Brooklyn Jail
results.abstract: The music mogul, who is charged with sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy, was denied bail and ordered held at a federal detention center. His lawyers are appealing.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Ben Sisario

multimedia.caption: Jailed defendants like Sean Combs who are awaiting trial on federal charges are typically housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, which has been criticized for poor conditions.

results.title: A Cape Cod Beach Shack Where Charm Takes Priority Over Air Conditioning
results.abstract: A minimalist Manhattan architect gets fresh air — and fresh eyes — at his family’s cluttered cabin.
results.byline: By Kurt Soller and Chris Mottalini

multimedia.caption: In the living room, a pine cube table by Finger and, beside the original fireplace with 19th-century andirons, vintage corduroy pillows from the ’70s on a CH163 sofa by Hans Wegner for Carl Hansen & Son upholstered in Lontano outdoor fabric by Élitis. The carpet is Persian.

results.title: The Menendez Brothers: What to Know Ahead of the New Netflix Series
results.abstract: “Monsters: The Lyle and Erik Menendez Story” chronicles the trials of two brothers who killed their parents in 1989, and their aftermath. Much has changed since then.

results.title: Derek Boshier, British Pop Artist and Bowie Collaborator, Dies at 87
results.abstract: Starting in the early 1960s, he set himself apart from his contemporaries with paintings that critiqued the cultural dominance of the United States.

results.title: Read the Indictment in the Sex Trafficking Case Against Sean Combs
results.abstract: Federal prosecutors issued an indictment against Sean Combs that accused the music mogul known as Diddy and Puff Daddy of running a criminal enterprise that included sex trafficking, forced labor and coercion and enticement to engage in prostitution.

results.title: A Derelict Townhouse Becomes a D.I.Y. Wonderland
results.abstract: How a collective of artists turned a crumbling Brussels building into their own creative playground.
results.byline: By Ellie Pithers and Philippe Braquenier

results.title: Design Doesn’t Have to Be Polite
results.abstract: Sometimes homes are best when you can see the rough edges.

multimedia.caption: Sperling and le Bleu designed and built virtually everything in the room they share, including a bed wrapped in strips of stainless steel; a hand-cut mattress with patchwork bedsheets; a pair of hemp fiber, oak and textile bedside lamps; and 12 paintings mounted to the ceiling.

results.title: Kimmel Takes Stock of Trump’s Rhetoric After Suspect’s Arrest
results.abstract: Jimmy Kimmel said the former president, who blamed Democrats for “highly inflammatory language,” was himself “not a calming influence.”

multimedia.caption: “Trump, of course, is blaming Kamala Harris and President Biden for this,” Jimmy Kimmel said, after a man with a gun was found near the former president as he golfed Sunday.

results.title: Jane’s Addiction to Cancel Tour After Onstage Fight
results.abstract: In a social media post, the rock band said it was halting its reunion tour after the group’s singer, Perry Farrell, hit its guitarist at a Boston show.

results.title: Gallery Owner Sentenced in Fine Art Photography Swindle
results.abstract: Wendy Halsted Beard, 59, agreed to sell photography prints on behalf of older collectors. She kept the profits for herself.

multimedia.caption: Wendy Halsted Beard, who ran a gallery out of her home in Franklin, Mich., has been sentenced to over five years in prison for defrauding collectors.

results.title: UFO 50 Is an Ingeniously Retro Advent Calendar
results.abstract: This compilation from a fictional ’80s video game company is constantly clever. By comparison, Atari’s latest resurrection effort, Yars Rising, is frustratingly banal.

multimedia.caption: UFO 50’s graphics are decidedly old school and the artists have done an admirable job with the meager 32 colors at their disposal.

results.title: Academic Plagiarism Complaint Against the Author of ‘White Fragility’ Dismissed
results.abstract: In a letter, the University of Washington stated that the evidence presented in the confidential complaint failed to meet the institution’s criteria for plagiarism.
des_facet: White Fragility: Why It's So Hard for White People to Talk about Racism (Book)

multimedia.caption: The University of Washington found there was no basis for conducting an investigation into Robin DiAngelo’s thesis, and dismissed the complaint that raised questions about her writing.
The University of Washington found there was no basis for conducting an investigation into Robin DiAngelo’s thesis, and dismissed the complaint that raised questions about her writing.

results.title: Books by Rachel Kushner and Percival Everett Make Booker Prize Shortlist
results.abstract: For the first time in the award’s 55-year history, five of the six nominated titles are by female authors.

results.title: ‘Shogun’: Here’s What to Know About the Record-Breaking Emmy Hit
results.abstract: The FX epic ruled TV’s top honors, racking up 18 Emmys for its first season. Here is a brief guide to this saga of samurai warriors and star-crossed lovers.
